alert.note: Alert for Riverside; San Bernardino (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued March 21 at 12:17PM PDT until further notice by NWS SanDiego
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 230 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of Southwest California, including the following counties, Riverside and San Bernardino. * WHEN...Until 230 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. Overflowing poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1216 PM PDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in Apple/El Dorado Burn areas. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Apple/El Dorado Burn areas may experience minor flooding. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 0.75 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Redlands, Yucaipa, Forest Falls, Mount San Gorgonio, Highland, Beaumont, Banning, Mountain Home Village, Hwy 38 Between Yucaipa And Onyx Summit and Angelus Oaks. - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
